channel.title: Hp proliant problems
channel.description:
Hey everyone, i just managed to install win server 08 onto my HP proliant after having alot of problems with hard-drives. it seems that whenever i have 2 or more of my SCSI hdds plugged into it it just freezes up and stops working, i have no idea what is causing this problem,
i have around SCSI card drivers lying around (idk what they are called, but they are expansion cards with 2-4 scsi slots) but i dont know how essencal they are because i just got given the server (along with a few others) and the guy who gave em to me dident say much about them, except for the specs. so i was wondering if any of you guys/girls have had any experience with scsi hdds and raid setups.
atm it got 3gb ram with a 3ghz xeon cpu, and 6 72 gb hdd's

item.title: Hp proliant problems
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

At least with a linux system you could check /var/log/messages or something for potential pointers about your problems. Don’t know if windows has something similar, I somehow suspect it would just crash windows.

Read full topic

item.title: Hp proliant problems
item.dc:creator: @shrogg shrogg
item.description:
@shrogg wrote:

i already have 2 linux servers, and this one is going to be used for game hosting, and i allready tryed installing ubuntu onto it aswell as debian they all have the same problems…
i have tryed putting the hdds in a different order and everything, idk whats up

Read full topic
